title: Lincoln Home National Historic Site: Soundscape / Noise
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Environmental Factors     Soundscape / Noise                Soundscape / Noise         Springfield Fire Truck   Lincoln Home visitors travel back in time to the middle of the 19th century as they walk the boardwalks and tree-lined streets of the neighborhood.   They might easily forget that Mr. Lincolnâ€™s neighborhood is in the midst of a busy urban environment.  The trees and shrubs may subdue the sounds of the city, but the cacophony of urban noise is always present at Lincoln Home.  Adjacent to the site are a fire station, railroad track, and urban traffic.   Fire engine sirens, train whistles, diesel trucks, buses, and lawn mowing equipment are part of the ambient noise of a 21st century city.
